name: Client
description: Functions that interact with Minecraft that don't fit into their own module.
overview: Functions that interact with Minecraft that don't fit into their own module. Accessible from scripts via the global `Client` variable.

methods.name: getMinecraft
methods.description: The raw Minecraft client instance. This provides raw access to the MinecraftClient java class. On fabric, methods, fields, and classes can be accessed via their intermediary names (ex. method_29043). If the minecraft version is 1.21.11 or beyond, they can be accessed via their unobfuscated Mojang names.
examples: const mc = Client.getMinecraft();

methods.name: getRegistryManager
methods.description: Returns a helper for interacting with Minecraft's registry.
examples:
const registryManager = Client.getRegistryManager();
const stoneBlock = registryManager.getBlock("minecraft:stone");

methods.name: createPacketByteBuffer
methods.description: Returns a helper to create, modify, and send Minecraft packets.
examples: const buffer = Client.createPacketByteBuffer();

methods.name: runOnMainThread
methods.signature: runOnMainThread(MethodWrapper runnable, boolean await, long watchdogMaxTime)
methods.description: Runs a task on the main Minecraft thread.

parameters.name: runnable
parameters.description: The task to run on the main Minecraft thread.

parameters.name: await
parameters.description: If true, blocks the script until the task is completed. Optional.

parameters.name: watchdogMaxTime
parameters.description: The maximum time in milliseconds for the watchdog to wait before killing the script if it becomes unresponsive. Optional.

methods.name: getGameOptions
methods.description: Returns a helper which gives access to all game options.
examples:
const options = Client.getGameOptions();
const fov = options.getFov();

methods.name: mcVersion
methods.description: Returns the current Minecraft version.
examples:
const version = Client.mcVersion();
Chat.log(`Running on Minecraft ${version}`); // e.g., "25w06a"

methods.name: getFPS
methods.description: Returns the FPS debug string from Minecraft.
examples:
const fps = Client.getFPS();
Chat.log(fps); // e.g., "120 fps"

methods.name: loadWorld
methods.description: Loads a singleplayer world.

parameters.name: folderName
parameters.description: The folder name of the singleplayer world to join.

examples: Client.loadWorld("New World");

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connects to a multiplayer server.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: The IP address of the server.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: The port of the server. Optional.

examples: Client.connect("hypixel.net");
Client.connect("localhost", 25565);

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects from the current server/world.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call after disconnecting. The function receives a boolean indicating if the disconnection was successful. Optional.

examples: Client.disconnect();

methods.name: shutdown
methods.description: Closes the client (stops the game). This method waits until the game has stopped, meaning no further code in the script is executed. This does not wait on joined threads, so your script may stop at an undefined point.
examples:
Client.shutdown();
// No more code will be executed

methods.name: waitTick
methods.description: Waits for a specified number of client ticks. If run from the main thread, this will throw an IllegalThreadStateException.

parameters.name: ticks
parameters.description: The number of client ticks to wait. Default is 1.

methods.name: ping
methods.description: Pings a server and returns information about it.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: The IP address of the server to ping.

methods.name: pingAsync
methods.description: Pings a server asynchronously.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: The IP address of the server to ping.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call with the result (serverInfo: ServerInfoHelper, error: IOException).

methods.name: cancelAllPings
methods.description: Cancels any ongoing pings started with pingAsync or ping if called from another thread.
examples: Client.cancelAllPings();

methods.name: getLoadedMods
methods.description: Returns a list of all loaded mods.

methods.name: isModLoaded
methods.description: Checks if a specific mod is loaded.

parameters.name: modId
parameters.description: The ID of the mod to check.

methods.name: getMod
methods.description: Gets the mod container for a specific mod ID.

parameters.name: modId
parameters.description: The ID of the mod to get.

methods.name: grabMouse
methods.description: Makes Minecraft believe that the mouse is currently inside the window. This will also automatically set the "Pause on Lost Focus" option to false.
examples: Client.grabMouse();

methods.name: isDevEnv
methods.description: Checks if the game is running in a development environment.

methods.name: getModLoader
methods.description: Returns the name of the mod loader (e.g., "Fabric", "Forge").
examples:
const loader = Client.getModLoader();
Chat.log(`Mod loader: ${loader}`); // e.g., "Fabric"

methods.name: getRegisteredBlocks
methods.description: Returns a list of all registered blocks as BlockHelper objects.
examples:
const blocks = Client.getRegisteredBlocks();
Chat.log(`There are ${blocks.size()} registered blocks.`);

methods.name: getRegisteredItems
methods.description: Returns a list of all registered items as ItemHelper objects.
examples:
const items = Client.getRegisteredItems();
Chat.log(`There are ${items.size()} registered items.`);

methods.name: exitGamePeacefully
methods.description: Tries to close the game gracefully, as if the player clicked the "Quit Game" button.
examples: Client.exitGamePeacefully();

methods.name: exitGameForcefully
methods.description: Forcefully terminates the game process.
examples: Client.exitGameForcefully();

methods.name: sendPacket
methods.description: Sends a packet to the server.

parameters.name: packet
parameters.description: The packet to send to the server.

methods.name: receivePacket
methods.description: Simulates receiving a packet from the server.

parameters.name: packet
parameters.description: The packet to be processed by the client.

examples:
const KeepAliveS2CPacket = Java.type("net.minecraft.class_2670");
Client.receivePacket(new KeepAliveS2CPacket(123456789n));

methods.name: getClipboard
methods.description: Previously located in `Utils` as `getClipboard`. Gets the system clipboard as a string.

methods.name: setClipboard
methods.description: Previously Located in `Utils` as `copyToClipboard`. Sets the system clipboard to the supplied string.
examples: Client.setClipboard("This text is now on the clipboard!");
